subject: Clarification regarding calculation of GST against change in rates from 18.07.2022 on the activity of construction of road in case of EPC projects under Change in Law - reg.
text: HRaly 744 <THNfgiferasrot (Ts&5 @Rdev &7 RNTAf 471r74, IRG TTR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) &44 T vi-5 Q 6, Trr-10, ErWT; #f fcvft 110 075 0 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/ Accounting and Taxes/2022 Policy Circular No.3.3.26/ 2022 dated 24th November, 2022 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/FGA/GST-2021-22/SM-Vol.-IV-EPCMCA (Comp. No. 172727)} Sub:: Clarification regarding calculation of GST against change in rates from 18.07.2022 on the activity of construction of road in case of EPC projects under Change in Law Ref:- Circular No. 3.3.15 dated 04.10.2017 2) Circular No. NHAI/ 'F&A/GST-2017-18/SM, 01.08.2018 3) Circular No_ NHAI/FGA/GST/2018-19/SM dt. 03.04.2019 Circular No. NHAI/F&A/IA/2019-20/Spl GST Audit dt. 01.09.2021 In continuation of the above circulars to the extent of applicability of GST on EPC projects, following is hereby clarified. As per the recommendations of 47th GST Council meeting held on 28th & 29th June, 2022 , Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, vide notification No.03/2022-CT(R) dated 13.07.2022, the rate percent of CGST on "Composite supply of works contract as defined in clause (119) of section 2 of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017, supplied by way of construction, erection, commissioning, installation, completion, fitting out, repair, maintenance, renovation, or alteration of, (a) a road, bridge, tunnel, or terminal for road transportation for use by general public;' has been substituted from 6 percent to 9 percent; thereby increasing the overall rate of GST on road construction service from 12% to 18%_ 2 Further , as there are 2 events of change in law from GST point of view, one being implementation of GST regime W.e:f. 01.07.2017 and second being change of rate of GST from 12% to 18% W.e.f. 18.07.2022, the GST Template (Annexure-I) as attached with the above circular is hereby modified by insertion of a column in earlier format to the extent of following: Value of Services rendered up to 30.06.2017 as per original contract price plus price escalation ji. Value of Services rendered from 01.07.2017 till 17.07.2022 as per original contract price plus price escalation & iii. Balance value of services to be rendered as per original contract price plus price escalation on or after 18.07.2022 3_ On the above, regarding applicability of Change in it is now clarified that:- Projects where bid due date was on or before 30.06.2017: For the projects where the last date of   submission of bids was on or  before 30.06.2017, there may arise following two situations: a. Work completed on or before 17.07.2022 (before change in rate of tax), or b. Work completed on or after 18.07.2022 (after change in rate of tax) Contd__2I - M 7 U m NHAL reg: Law,
